params.amountDSCToBurn: The amount of DSC to burn

params.amountCollateral: The amount of collateral to deposit
params.tokenCollateralAddress: The address of the token to deposit as collateral

params.amountCollateral: The amount of collateral to deposit
params.amountDSCToMint: The amount of DSC to mint
params.tokenCollateralAddress: The address of the token to deposit as collateral

getAccountCollateralValue(address).details: loop thru each collateral token, get the ETH/BTC amount user have deposited on each collaterals take those amount getUSDValue() for each token.

params.totalCollateralValueInUSD: The total amount user have deposited in current USD price

params.user: The address of the user being checked

params.dscAmountInWei: The amount of dollars in wei (eg. 50e18 50$)
params.token: The token address of the collateral being checked (eth or btc)

params.amount: The amount of the token in ETH or BTC value (eg 1e18ETH)
params.token: The token address of the collateral being checked (eth or btc)

params.collateral: : The ERC20 token address of the collateral you're using to make the protocol solvent again.
params.debtToCover: : The amount of DSC you want to repay/burn to cover the user debt.
params.user: : The user to liquidate, who is insolvent. Must have a _healthFactor below MIN_HEALTH_FACTOR 1

params.amountDSCToMint: The amount of DSC tokens users want to get (mint)

burnDsc(uint256).notice: If the value of a user's collateral quickly falls, users will need a way to quickly rectify the collateralization of their LCD.

burnDscAndRedeemCollateral(address,uint2.notice: This function combines burns DSC and then redeem users collateral in one transaction

depositCollateral(address,uint256).notice: This is how users acquire the stablecoin, they deposit collateral greater than the value of the DSC mintedfollows CEI Pattern

depositCollateralAndMintDsc(address,uint.notice: This function is the combination of depositCollateral + mintDsc functions so user doesn't have to call each separatelyit will deposit the Collateral and mint the DSC in one transaction

getAccountCollateralValue(address).notice: Given an user, it returns the total collateral deposited converted to Dollar

getHealthFactor(address).notice: View an account's healthFactor, as the value of a user's collateral falls, will their healthFactorIf a user's healthFactor falls below 1 threshold, the user will be at risk of liquidation.

getTokenAmountFromDSC(address,uint256).notice: Pricing helper to get TOKEN amount of a collateral deposited.Takes X DSC dollars and returns how much ETH is needed to match that value at current price

getUSDValue(address,uint256).notice: Pricing helper to get USD amount of a collateral deposited

liquidate(address,address,uint256).notice: Users can repay someone elses debt (DSC) on their behalf if undercollateralized, and get rewarded with some of their collateral + 10% LIQUIDATION_BONUSThis function working assumes that the protocol will be roughly 125% overcollateralized in order for this to work.A bug would be if the protocol was only 100% collateralized, we wouldn't be able incentive liquidators or to liquidate anyone. Example: if the price of the collateral plummeted before anyone could be liquidated.

mintDsc(uint256).notice: Mints the stablecointhey must have more collateral than the minimum threshold, follows CEI Pattern.

redeemCollateral(address,uint256).notice: This function allows users to return DSC to the protocol in exchange for their underlying collateralIn order for them to redeem Collateral, the health factor must be greater than 1 after collateral is pulled
